leadingComments.value: Add and enable the isometric plug-in.

trailingComments.value: This is used to set a game canvas-based offset for the 0, 0, 0 isometric coordinate - by default
this point would be at screen coordinates 0, 0 (top left) which is usually undesirable.

leadingComments.value: This is used to set a game canvas-based offset for the 0, 0, 0 isometric coordinate - by default
this point would be at screen coordinates 0, 0 (top left) which is usually undesirable.
hud.addChild(game.add.rectangle(STAGE_WIDTH - 100, STAGE_HEIGHT - 200, 100, 200));

trailingComments.value: Create a group for our tiles.

leadingComments.value: Create a group for our tiles.

trailingComments.value: Let's make a load of tiles on a grid.

leadingComments.value: Let's make a load of tiles on a grid.

trailingComments.value: Provide a 3D position for the cursor

leadingComments.value: Provide a 3D position for the cursor
game.add.image(0, 0, "grass")
Update the cursor position.
It's important to understand that screen-to-isometric projection means you have to specify a z position manually, as this cannot be easily
determined from the 2D pointer position without extra trickery. By default, the z position is 0 if not set.

trailingComments.value: Loop through all tiles and test to see if the 3D position from above intersects with the automatically generated IsoSprite tile bounds.
If it does, do a little animation and tint change.

leadingComments.value: console.log(tile);
tile.infoPanel = game.add.image(tile.x, tile.y, "tile_info_bg")

trailingComments.value: If not, revert back to how it was.

leadingComments.value: game.add.image();
game.add.tween(tile).to({ isoZ: 4 }, 200, Phaser.Easing.Quadratic.InOut, true);
If not, revert back to how it was.
If it does, do a little animation and tint change.
Loop through all tiles and test to see if the 3D position from above intersects with the automatically generated IsoSprite tile bounds.
game.add.tween(tile).to({ isoZ: 0 }, 200, Phaser.Easing.Quadratic.InOut, true);
Create a tile using the new game.add.isoSprite factory method at the specified position.
The last parameter is the group you want to add it to (just like game.add.sprite)

comments.value: Add and enable the isometric plug-in.
This is used to set a game canvas-based offset for the 0, 0, 0 isometric coordinate - by default
this point would be at screen coordinates 0, 0 (top left) which is usually undesirable.
hud.addChild(game.add.rectangle(STAGE_WIDTH - 100, STAGE_HEIGHT - 200, 100, 200));
game.add.image(0, 0, "grass")
Create a group for our tiles.
Let's make a load of tiles on a grid.
Provide a 3D position for the cursor
Update the cursor position.
It's important to understand that screen-to-isometric projection means you have to specify a z position manually, as this cannot be easily
determined from the 2D pointer position without extra trickery. By default, the z position is 0 if not set.
Loop through all tiles and test to see if the 3D position from above intersects with the automatically generated IsoSprite tile bounds.
If it does, do a little animation and tint change.
console.log(tile);
tile.infoPanel = game.add.image(tile.x, tile.y, "tile_info_bg")
game.add.image();
game.add.tween(tile).to({ isoZ: 4 }, 200, Phaser.Easing.Quadratic.InOut, true);
If not, revert back to how it was.
game.add.tween(tile).to({ isoZ: 0 }, 200, Phaser.Easing.Quadratic.InOut, true);
Create a tile using the new game.add.isoSprite factory method at the specified position.
The last parameter is the group you want to add it to (just like game.add.sprite)
